alert.note: Alert for Petersburg Borough; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 24 at 3:02PM AKST until December 24 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SNOW CONTINUES OVER THE CENTRAL PANHANDLE THIS EVENING... Snow continues to be heavy to moderate over the Kupreanof Island and Kuiu Island areas this evening. Another round of snow is expected for the northern panhandle Sun afternoon into Sun night. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 15 inches. * WHERE...Petersburg, Kake, Port Alexander, and surrounding areas. * WHEN...Until 9 PM AKST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility near downtown Juneau. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow rates continue to be moderate to heavy around the area. Around 7 inches of snow had already accumulated around Petersburg by midday. Expect another 2 to 5 inches of snow through the evening hours with low visibility at times.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.

area.areaDesc: Petersburg Borough; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island
